title: Smaller than you'd think
review: Quite an eerie hush when you enter the inside of the Taj.  A one way system is operated, which is a necessity.  You are not allowed to take photographs and on this the guards are very strict although I did see one young girl take a photo on her phone and she had a fight to keep the guards from confiscating the phone. Might have been easier for them to ask her to delete the photograph maybe. Anyway, inside is not as elaborate as I thought it would be, there are the two tombs there and again it is important to know the history behind the tombs to get the real benefit of the attraction.

title: A great building next to the Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical buildings , one on each side of the Taj Mahal. One is a Mosque and one is a guest house. I believe this is the Mosque.

title: Next to Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical and symmetrical red sandstone buildings either  side of the glistening white Taj Mahal. This one is a Mosque and I believe that the other offers some type of accommodation.  Photography is banned inside.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: This is an additional treat that can be seen once inside the security area. It is lovely and I am glad I visited it, but be aware there are steps.

title: Stunning, but almost ignored
review: If Jawab Masjid was on its own, and not 100 metres from the Taj Mahal, you'd want to go and visit it.  But it's totally overshadowed by the Taj Mahal and many people don't even bother to walk the very short distance to look at it.

title: stunning
review: Stunning building. is such a massive building as well. Well worth a visit and you can get some brilliant pictures.

title: Beautiful monument
review: This beautiful red sandstone building stands as a sharp contrast to Taj Mahal's white marble monument. in its entirety; it looks very beautiful. #suhaskatti

title: Mosque next to Taj Mahal
review: This beautiful mosque rather loses out in comparison to its illustrious neighbour, but it certainly has its own beauty and appeal, especially the contrasting colours.

title: Beautiful
review: This part of the Taj Mahal was designed by three architects from three different religions. They combined their ideas to build a red sandstone building with carvings that  beg you to photograph them. The late afternoon sun gave the stone a glow that added to its beauty.

title: Beautiful sculpture
review: This red building inside Taj Mahal  - Agra is a must watch with its actual beauty. Would have been even more better if there was a notice board depicting the importance of the tomb and the reason behind the building

title: Inside the Taj
review: This is one of the side mosques in the Taj Mahal. BUilt with Red stone and three white Gumbad makes a stunning view.

title: The only mosque overlooking east
review: Jawab Masjid inside Taj Mahal is a red stone mosque made for the aesthetic appeal to maintain the symmetry with the mosque on the left side of Taj Mahal.

title: Another stunning piece of architecture
review: Jawab Masjid is on the side of the Taj Mahal & it has some beautiful mosaics & designs. Take time out from the Taj to visit this Mosque as it is great

title: taaj mahal delight
review: a nice masjid. made of nice colour and well maintained. located within taaj mahal. u can easily see it while visiting taaj mahal,

title: One of the two buildings that bookend the Taj Mahal
review: The one on the left of the Taj (as you're facing it) is a working mosque, whilst the identical building on the right was used as a guest house for visiting pilgrims.

title: Inside Taj place
review: This is the place inside the Taj Mahal where people were doing the prayer to god. This gives the idea of olden days.

title: inside the taj
review: when visiting the taj mahal with newmarket travel, our guide took us inside the building itself. very calm and spiritual.

title: Stunning
review: The Jawab Masjid is located in the Taj Mahal. It is a stunning monument. Definitely worth a visit when you visit the Taj.

title: Enhances the Priceless Beauty of The Taj
review: There are two identical mosques on both sides of the Taj Mahal. Made out of red sandstone, one can endlessly keep marveling at it's timeless architecture.

title: More than the Taj
review: Although one normally just sees pictures of the main facility at the Taj Mahal, there are other buildings such as this mosque  lots to see and roam around and take pictures of

title: Beautiful building flanking the Taj Mahal
review: Two identical building flank each side of Taj Mahal. Built of red standstone they are huge and fine pieces of architecture. On Fridays, holy days, used as a working Mosque. The Taj is closed on a Friday because of this. Splendid building.

title: Made by red sand stone
review: Jawab masjid was one of the great location to visit in Agra. This masjid is built with red sand stone and have beautiful architecture. Must visit during Agra visit.

title: Good
review: The five principal elements of the complex—main gateway, garden, mosque. jawab (literally “answer”; a building mirroring the mosque), and mausoleum (including its four minarets)—were conceived and designed as a unified entity according to the tenets of Mughal building practice, which allowed no subsequent addition or alteration. Building commenced about 1632. More than 20,000 workers were employed from India, Persia, the Ottoman Empire, and Europe to complete the mausoleum itself by about 1638–39; the adjunct buildings were finished by 1643, and decoration work continued until at least 1647.

title: Jawab Masjid
review: This is located inside the Taj Mahal Complex and is one of three gates, Although one normally just sees pictures of the main Taj Mahal, there are plenty of other buildings such as this mosque.  There is plenty to see in and around the complex and many photo oppurtunities.All these building are symetrical and absolutely in line with arches and center line throughout the construction.

title: Entrance to time past
review: It was really amazing standing in the shadow of this  timeless  building. You can't take your eyes off it when you first see it.

title: Other View at Taj Mahal, Jawab Masjid
review: Beautiful Taj Mahal , all people know that. but not only Taj Mahal, but other building at there all so beautiful.

title: Very Poorly Maintained
review: Sad to see this place which has so Old History has lost its charm completely. Its in covered with Bird Poo and very smelly, may be maintenance is completely neglected in this part of Taj

title: Holy Place within Tajmahal complex
review: This Masjid is located on left side of the Tajmahal and used for prayers on Fridays. It is very crowded on Fridays and so entry to the Tajmahal complex is allowed only for prayers on Fridays.

title: Architectural Beauty and revered place
review: This Masjid was built to do Friday prayers at the Taj . This place is very crowded on Fridays . Built with red stone and marble, this beautiful structure is totally symmetrical and complete answer to the questions of a perfectionist .

title: Lovely mosque
review: Overlooked by the Taj many forget to visit this tranquill mosque up on the same platform as the Taj Mahal.   This should not be missed.

title: Red mosque inside Taj Mahal complex
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the spectacular Taj Mahal complex and this mosque built in red sandstone and white marble is located on the left side of Taj Mahal. This mosque is still used on Friday to offer prayers when the Taj Mahal remains closed for tourists. The mosque has a long hall and 3 beautiful white domes on the top. Like the Taj, the architectural symmetry of this structure is just perfect.

title: Inside the Taj complex, but restricted entry
review: Jawab Masjid is a mosque inside the Taj Mahal complex. The size and architecture of this mosque gives you the glimpse of Mughal's architecture. Though being a religious place the entry inside it is restricted, though you can road outside it without any issues. It is located on the left side of Taj Mahal when facing it.

title: interesting additional building
review: The Taj is more than what everyone knows.  The Jawab Masjid is off to one side and worth exploring if you have the time

title: Nice Mosque
review: This is just an additional building when you visit Taj Mahal. Beautiful Mosque anyway. There are too similar buildings both side Taj for the sake of symmetry.

title: Mosque adjoining to TajMahal
review: When you go to TajMahal you will find this majestic red coloured Building close to the main building. It's worth to visit this place also.

title: Beautiful mosque
review: This lovely example of Mahal architecture is a mosque, so entry is restricted.  The exterior is worth spending some time appreciating.

title: beautiful
review: What an amazing experience at this beautiful place.  Amazing architecture to enjoy.  peaceful.  It can get quite busy.

title: The Entrance to the Taj Mahal Complex
review: This imposing red sandstone structure is one of four at each side of the symmetrical gardens surrounding the Taj Mahal. It is a combination of Mogul (muslim) and Hindu architecture since both sects were involved in its construction.

title: Worth Watching
review: Jawab mosque remains in a superb location. It's pretty gorgeous. Its design is worth seeing. I think that you should also experience.

title: Not a working mosque
review: The Jawab Masjid is a red stone mosque that was solely built for for aesthetic appeal.  Prayers are not offered here and it was built to provide symmetry with the real mosque that is across the courtyard to the left of the Taj Mahal.

title: Just stunning
review: The main attraction of course if the amazing Taj Mahal but there are 2 of these on each side.  A great way to reflect and get away from the crowds.  Also good place to take photos although the right side is better due to not having scaffolding.  Well worth the 5 minutes to walk over after experiencing the Taj Mahal.

title: Inside Taj
review: The builidng is very interesting and the story behind and relating to the Taj Mahal once you learn the story the building makes sense.

title: see whilst on your visit to the Taj Mahal
review: yet another piece of stunning architecture and design, these are truly beautiful buildings and worth a visit

title: Okayish....can be visited once
review: We were here during our Agra tour. It was a quick stopover. There were entry restrictions to the holy place.

title: Beautiful mosque overshadowed by the Taj Mahal
review: The Jawab Masjid is a mosque on the right side and within the Taj Mahal. The Taj Mahal is flanked by 2 mosques, the left still conducts prayers and therefore the Taj Mahal can not be accessed on Friday as we were told. The Jawb Masjid is the other mosque which we were told does not hold prayers but is great visit to view the building as well as to view the Taj Mahal from a different perspective.

title: Very interesting
review: Another beautiful building  has great views of the. Taj Mahal , very much the  secondary site to the Taj

title: Beautiful
review: Moghul architecture has such a beautiful form. The proportions, decoration and embellishments are just superb.

title: Jawab masjid
review: It's inside taj Mahal where not much attention is focused u can have quick view over it and have good pix

title: Impressive Holy Place
review: Monday the 12th February and we took an organised tour of the incredible Taj Mahal.

title: Tough to compete with Taj Mahal
review: Jawab Masjid is a mosque located right next to the Taj Mahal. It is very beautiful, but next to the Taj Mahal it loses part of its "luster".  Still very much worth taking the few extra minutes to walk over and see.

title: Great insight to the Architects
review: This is like a mini Taj Mahal, it is amazing to view the vision/ design of the architects back in the day. Everything was symmetrical and this places shows it off to perfection. Well worth visiting when in Agra.

title: typical indian mosque
review: this is a typical indian mosque, it is not very big inside but the arabesque are very nice. the decoration is very simple and for muslims visiting taj mahal, it is a good place where to pray (it is opened all the time and you can do your Friday prayer there)

title: As interesting as the Taj
review: We don´t pay much attention to this mosque because is beside Taj Mahal but after going inside and walking around the Taj and take pictures from every angle, yes we can admire it a little.

title: Stunning
review: ... is a word I'm using a lot today but all the places we visited in India are & seriously so! Well worth a visit.

title: A place of peace in Taj Mahal...
review: This is a big mosque situated just adjecent to the Taj Mahal Complex... There is enough space to pray in the mosque and is a marvel as far as architecture is concerned...

title: Mosque within Taj Mahal complex
review: Located within Taj Mahal complex. Can be used to capture sunrise pictures. Shoes not allowed as it is a place of worship.

title: Beautiful neighbor of the Taj Mahal
review: The red buildings neighboring the Taj Mahal are commonly overlooked when taking pictures of the Taj despite their artistic paintings and great architecture. Their red stone provide the perfect frame to let the Taj Mahal shine. As they are right next to the Taj there is no way of not seeing them if you go to the Taj Mahal, what you definitely should do when in the area.

title: Peaceful and serene, just beside the Taj !!
review: A beautiful mosque located on the left site of Taj Mahal, very peaceful place and a holy site for muslims to offer thier namaz.

title: The often overlooked mosque at the Taj Mahal
review: While visiting the iconic Taj Mahal, one can be forgiven for being distracted and not paying as much attention to the two buildings that flank the Taj Mahal. However, that would be a mistake. The beautiful reddish building to the left of the Taj Mahal (when facing the Taj Mahal) with the white domes is the Jawab Mosque. Next to the Taj Mahal, it does not look that big, but upon approaching it, the Jawab Masjid is a pretty massive structure that has a beautiful, traditional design that very much complements the Taj Mahal.

title: One of Asia's largest mosques, and very popular
review: The supply you with gowns, and you must be prepared to take off your shoes, or you can buy slippers. The mosque was really busy but worth while, and I would take the time to visit. Again it is good to get away from the madness outside with some calm.

title: An Agra essential
review: Agra is a fascinating city with many faces. Of course the Taj Mahal is the main attraction, but in a well planned day this amazing city will open the vault on so much history about India. Highly recommended

title: Mosque inside Taj
review: It is inside the taj mahal and not open for public. You can have a panoramic view of the Mughal's art only from outside. You can have nice click outside.

title: A mosque?
review: I did not know that Taj Mahal is a islamic complex. So I did not expect to see a mosque insdie of Taj Mahal. So I was shocked! However, the mosque is so beautiful, well decorated in Mughal Style.

title: Huge and Magnificent
review: Located inside the Taj complex, it is built in perfect symmetry to the Taj Mahal itself. It is as big and grand as the Taj. Do realize that it is a mosque and a place of prayer so remove your footwear when stepping into it. Peel yourself away from admiring the beauty of the Taj and do concentrate some of your appreciation for this beautiful piece of architecture.

title: Beautiful Masjid!!!
review: Jawab Masjid is inside the place of Taj Mahal. This place is very beautiful, excellent and architecture design was superb. Well Maintained place.

title: Wonderful Mosque
review: A great architectural venture and an example of the beauty of Mughal Architecture in India.The Mosque is something magnificent.

title: Worth stopping for a few minutes
review: Really easy to walk right through this as most people are very eager to get to the Taj Mahal which is through this structure. On the way out I would definitely recommend stopping and appreciating this monument as the architecture and detail on it is stunning!

title: Juma Masjid
review: This is a mosque to the left side of the Taj Mahal. Its a colossal structure like any of the Mughal buildings.

title: Very Nice
review: This red stone Mosque sits on the side of the Taj, naturally facing east. It is a beautiful red stone structure. Unfortunately, it pales by comparison to the Taj.

title: Overshadowed
review: Like every other building in Agra the Jawab Masjid is overshadowed by the Taj Mahal but it really is a beautiful building in its own right.  If you can drag your eyes away from the iconic Taj, spend some time gazing at this.

title: The red mosque
review: It is a mosque inside Taj complex, a red stone structure made for the aesthetic appeal to maintain the symmetry with  Taj Mahal. It's as big as Taj Mahal and beautifully decorated.  This mosque faces East owing to which it is not used for daily prayers. However, people still use the place for Friday prayers.

title: Good Monument
review: A good monument inside the Taj, Good to witness the Mughal Era art of construction. This gives a good look to TAJ.

title: Hey!!! Its the place where all the best photos taking in Taj Mahall
review: This masjid is amazing like as the Taj's itself. If you please you can visit there with early morning or late evening tours. This Masjid is a perfect spot for the smelling air of Taj Mahall. Just Amazing.

title: This place very good
review: I am giong in febuary to visit and see this place are very good and beautyful the photos was amazing of the structure

title: Jawab masjid
review: Jawab masjid is another mughal era structure..masjid ia beautifull mughal style architect..on agra tour decent to came here

title: Mosque inside the taj mahal
review: This is the masjid / mosque made with red stone and mughal style architecture. It's situated inside the taj mahal complex only. Nice one but not best like taj.

title: The Mosque in side the Taj Mahal.
review: While visiting The Taj Mahal, if time is there to offer Namaz (Prayer), it can be offered inside this Maszid (Mosque). It is very much inside the premises.

title: The Mosque witin Taj
review: This mosque in Taj is in very good condition. The writings at front side, and the height of mosque will excite you. One should capture snaps of this place and view taj from its gate.

title: Jawab Mosque - Balancing Opposite Forces in Mahal's Architectural Heaven
review: Jawab Masjid / Mosque is a red stone mosque made for the aesthetic appeal to maintain the symmetry with the mosque on the left side of Taj Mahal. It's interesting how this mosque gets its name. 'Jawab,' meaning 'answer' was made as a response to the mosque on the left to maintain symmetrical balance. Since it faces east, no prayers are offered in this mosque. Included in your ticket for Taj Mahal, and sometimes only opened during Friday, Its vaults and arches are beautiful, so try to spend at least 1 hour, its worth the stop.

title: Jawab Majid @ Taj Mahal
review: The Jawab masjid is situated within the Taj Mahal area.

title: Beautiful
review: This is inside the Taj Mahal .. The structure is made of red sandstone unlike taj .. They add to the beauty and also has a lot of significance.. The structure supports the taj mahal..

title: Entrance to beauty.
review: This takes you through to the real star of India - the Taj. This is also interesting because of all the attached history so worth taking the time to look and listen.

title: Beautifu
review: All the surrounding areas were just wonderful, I didn't realise that there was so much more to the Taj Mahal. The architecture and workmanship of these buildings are just astounding. A must see.

title: Do Not forget to visit here when at the Taj Mahal
review: We had only ever seen the Taj Mahal so when we arrived and saw the Jawab Masjid we were delighted. The building complements the Taj Mahal. Another building with the most amazing decoration which would be hard to replicate today with our modern tech knowledge.

title: Nice architecture
review: Nice temple just behind the red fort, near the old city. Really worth a couple of pictures. Wear conservative clothing or rent at the gate.

title: Mosque inside TAJ
review: The Jawab Masjid isnt a beauty or an attraction separately by itself.  It is located inside the Taj Mahal garden.  It is basically a mosque and there are lots of people who still visit to worship and say prayers.

title: beautiful mosque
review: Jawab Masjid is located inside Taj Mahal garden . architecture of this mosque like as Taj Mahal is a combination of Persian , Islamic and Indian architecture and too beautiful like as Taj Mahal .

title: Gorgeous
review: If your looking at the Taj Mahal from the entrance, the mosque is the building on the left. It is a functional mosque and still has worshipers. It was a beautiful addition to see while at the Taj Mahal.

title: Excellent mosque within Taj Compound
review: This is a beautiful mosque within the Taj compund. I never knew that Taj Mahal is just one of the pearls of the famous agra buildings. It is made up of red sandstone with beautiful carving.

title: Shah Hahan
review: One"s first glimpse of the architect you created the Taj Mahal as with all his constructions Detailed simplicity a must see

title: relax
review: good place to relax your mind. if you been there you can learn about Muslim culture . people they will help you for your nice visit.

title: A beautiful change of color and pattern to the stark white of the Taj Mahal
review: While the Taj was barely visible on the morning I arrived, I ventured in to the Jawab Masjid, looking for some different angles on the Taj, and different tones to photograph (I'm a professional photographer). I loved the deep reds, with beautiful patterns and paintings, as well as the numerous archways. My favorite photos of the Taj are through the archways here.

title: Take a few minutes for a different view
review: it's worth stepping away from the Taj and walking across the plaza for a few moments of reflection and to get another perspective on the Taj itself.

title: Jawab Masjid
review: This is a mosque inside the Taj Complex. The construction is in red sand stone and it has one main archway leading to the interior of the mosque. The white domes and the white strip of marble on the front facade give this monument a beautiful look. Worth taking time to visit this mosque.

title: Very beautiful in its own right
review: This working Mosque is located to the left of the Taj Mahal.  It is a beautiful building made of red sandstone and marble.  The Taj Mahal complex is closed on Fridays because they have services in the Mosque on Fridays.  We took beautiful photos of this building from the balcony of the Taj.

title: Mosque by the Taj Mahal
review: Situated within the Taj Mahal complex this divine building is in daily use for prayer for the faithful.

title: Bonus attraction
review: Sitting next to the Taj Mahal this building is of equal attraction with its intricate carvings. With the river as a backdrop it makes for good photography .

title: Interesting insight into another world...
review: We had not expected that there were other buildings in and around the Taj Mahal so this was totally unexpected yet very interesting to hear the history.

title: Part of the Taj Mahal area...
review: As a part of the Taj Mahal area you will find the Jawab Masjid on the left side. The Mosque is build in red stones and marble and inside tiny, but impressive views. Closed on fridays.

title: Beautiful in its own right
review: The Jawab Masjid is a beautiful structure and you shouldn’t overlook it when you visit the Taj Mahal. Be sure to get it in some of your Taj photos too!

title: Inseparable from the Taj
review: An integral part of the Taj complex, it lends a gravity to the entire cluster of buildings. Without the Jawab Masjid the Taj will be a little less magnificent...

title: All of the buildings included in the Taj Mahal Tour are well worth seeing and worthy of their reputations.
review: I think if you have a good guide you can learn so much of the history of this wonderful area.  For me to elaborate any further on each individual one would not do any of them justice.  I highly recommend you take the tour and make up your own minds.

title: Taj Mahal Mosque
review: Another mosque.

title: Impressive in its own right
review: Dwarfed in attention by the Taj Mahal, the Jawab Masjid is breath taking in its own right, so worth a visit. The best view and photo position is from the left hand side of the Taj Mahal main balcony.

title: nice and beautiful
review: a beautiful piece of art of mughal times. It is inside the taj mahal, so separate time and fees is there.

title: Don't ignore
review: Many simply focus on the main monument, the Taj itself but many of the surrounding buildings have their own charm and story. Please take the time to enter and wander around the complex as a whole. If nothing else, the view of the Taj Mahal from this place are amazing, especially with the rising or setting sun behind or on it, respectively.

title: Great
review: Lovely sight to take in, very interesting and a must see if you are visiting India. Busy most of the time but worth seeing.

title: Burial Chamber within the Mahal
review: gets very crowed and lots of pushing and shoving goes on. Guards try to control this. Not suitable for young children or those with claustrobia

title: Very good architecture
review: The mosque is on the left hand side while entering the TAJ and there is a similar building that is built on the right hand side of the Taj as well and it seems this was made in order to balance the foundation of the TAJ.

title: Next to the Taj
review: There are two matching mosques on either side of the Taj, quite nice but cannot go in.  The colored local stone is a nice contrast to the brilliant Taj.

title: Ancient Mosque inside the "Taj"
review: This mosque from outside looks great, but when you go inside you can find out the maintenance is not good enough. it is dirty because of bird nets in some corner of the ceiling. Some part of the domes ceiling already starting damage. However since this mosque is attached with the Taj Mahal complex, so still interesting to have a look and understand its history.

title: place to rest and pray
review: I had a chance to pray here, up to 500  people pray here on a Friday. Prayer mats are built in. lot of Monkeys and parrots are occupant on the trees by the side of the Masjid

title: One of the inspirations for the Taj Mahal
review: Dating much earlier than the Taj, this monument was one of the buildings that inspired the Taj.  You only need 30 minutes to and hour at this site.

title: Wonderful mosque to see next to the Taj Mahal
review: Built at the same time as the Taj, 22 years 20,000 builders.

title: Beautiful in its own Way
review: It is beautiful as Taj Mahal. We spent a lot time there and feel very relaxing. you can do prayer also. Jawab madjid is a beautiful architecture in its own way and needs sometime to appreciate but hardly gets 5 minutes to its proximity to Taj Mahal.

title: Beautiful Jawab Masjid in Taj Mahal Precincts...
review: The Jawab Masjid inside Taj Mahal , Agra, is a red stone mosque basically made for aesthetic appeal. Its located within the precincts of the glorious Taj Mahal.  As the mosque faces east, prayers are not offered here. Jawab Masjid is known as a 'jawab' or an answer to the mosque and hence the name.

title: superb
review: my biggest mistake was that i traveled in the month of june..avoid summers....rest is superb ...excellent and very good for family

title: beautiful mosque in taj.
review: This is also a beautiful mosque from the mughal period. This is a beautiful mosque with white marble and red sand stone.On Friday lots of local people comes to pray in this mosque.The same identical mosque was built on east side to provide the symmetry and this was used as a guest house.

title: Nice Architecture
review: Jawab Masjid was built in red sandston inside the Taj Mahal Area, Jawab Masjid Agra beautiful piece of architecture.

title: Quiet holly place
review: Small masque beside the taj mahal. Buid with red and with stones. Intrestingly incontrast with the TajMahal.

title: My big adventure in India
review: Visited many historical monuments, palaces, temples, this one was one of the great ones, so much history, the decoration, natural red stone, breath taking.

title: If you visit Agra, this becomes the must visit spot.
review: If you visit Agra, this becomes the must visit spot. You will be amazed to see the architectural marvel.

title: Great!
review: A wonderful place in the middle of the amazing land of India!

title: Great building but very badly kept
review: This is an operating mosque and hence difficult to understand why it is so badly maintained (the pigeons seem to be having a good time though). Worth a look...

title: "View at sunrise"
review: This is one of the great wonders of the world and the moment you set eyes on it your captivated  by it's beauty, try to get there for sunrise the best time of the day to take photos and not so crowded.

title: Amazing architicture & grounds!
review: I had not idea this mosque was on the grounds of the Taj Mahal.  There is a matching structure on the opposite side as well, which has not purpose but is open to see.  The inlay work on both are incredible.

title: Fantastic place
review: Great place to take pictures as the monument is beautiful. Good attraction on a sunny day. I really enjoyed the Jawab Masjid.

title: A complement to a wonder
review: Jawab Masjid is an apposite monument adjacent to Tajmahal is a replica of a mosque on another side of taj, built for aesthetically purposes.

title: Mosque Next to Taj
review: Jawab masjid is on the left aide of Taj Mahal. An exact replica is on the right aide which was guest house. Jawab madjid is a beautiful pièce of architecture in its own right and needs sometime to appreciate but hardly gets 5 minutes sur to its proximity to Taj Mahal. I have prayed There twice as it is a functional mosque.

title: Beautiful in its own right
review: Often overlooked du to its proximity to its more famous cousin fight next door. Nevertheless a beautiful piece of architectural craftsmanship which deserves time and attention. Well worth visiting.

title: Taj Mahal's unknown little brother
review: Beautiful tomb. It's quite unknown, probably because the raging Taj Mahal close by. I would recommend walking through Jawab Masjid when going to Taj Mahal. It's easiest to get to if you enter by the west gate.

title: You are here so why not
review: We visited at the opening time, even so the crowds were massed, and we still had to queue for a lengthy period. Admittedly is was on the weekend. Regardless, I still think the crowds would increase throughout the day. From a photographic perspective, the morning had a small amount of pollution fog, I did hear that throughout the day it thickens.

title: Pray within Taj
review: Masjid is on the adjacent side of Taj Mahal. Red sandstone is beautiful. Nice engraving. Do take photos. Very quiet and peaceful. We visited in April but its best to go there in Feb or November like weather.

title: Do not just go for the white marble.
review: We went to the Taj Mahal, not expecting anything other than the famous mausoleum and were delighted to find this. You cannot miss it as it is on the way to the Taj, but take time to have a good look round before going through into the grounds. There is much of interest, both white marble and red sandstone with lots of great decorations.

title: “Beautiful Architecture”
review: Jawab Masjid inside The Taj Mahal. This mosque is still used for Friday prayers. Jawab Masjid  made up of red sandstone. Which is on the left of the Taj.

title: Sharing The Same Land With The Taj
review: Jawab Masjid built by Shah Jahan during the same time of the Taj Mahal. Jawab Masjid located on the right wing of the Taj.Mahal  and known as Taj Mahal mosque. Made of red sandstone, the mosque facing West on the direction of Mecca. The monument open for visitors from 7am-6pm everyday except on Fridays. The

title: Jawab Masjid
review: Another mosque.  It's main distinction is it is inside the Taj Mahal.  Also built in symmetrical style.  ANother building, excatly the same was built on the other side of the Taj to maintain symmetry.

title: In the complex of Taj Mahal.
review: This building is at the side of the Taj Mahal. It is another impressive thing to visit within the complex.

title: Masha Allah
review: As usual not comments for mosques, but architect were really amazing pray and relax very next to taj mahal

title: Good architecture
review: Jawab masjid is very good place. Very good architecture and close to Taj Mahal. Jawab masjid made by red stone. Look like Taj Mahal.

title: same place inside of taj mahal
review: Must see but should take local guide to know better historical event.this masjid u can pray in friday.

title: Gorgeous
review: Just as gorgeous as you would hope. it isn't the Taj Mahal- however it is gorgeous. There are two similar buildings adjacent to the Taj and a great photo op. We were unable to go inside in january.

title: In the Shadow of the Taj
review: The Jawab Masjid is a part of the Taj Mahal complex itself and offers some spectacular view of the Taj to the shutterbugs. There is nothing historically important about the mosque and the same is also conveyed by the tour guides available there for a fee.

title: For serious pilgrimage visitors
review: This place is for serious pilgrimage visitors, not for photo freaks as there is not much to talk about this place

title: Non functional
review: In the east of tajmahal this building was built to maintain the symmetry. It was non functional. One thing you can see their the drawing of the large pinnacle.

title: intimate, small historicall important sight
review: This sight was inside the Taj area and worth doing because I didn't feel as overwhelmed by crowds and guides that haunt the Taj.

title: Beautiful Masjid
review: Spiritual experience during visit of Taj Mahal. Also great to hide from rain and watch Taj Mahal :-))))

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: The Jawab Masjid is a symmetrical design and structure to the mosque on the opposite side. The whole thing in Taj Maha is breathtaking and Jawab Masjid is no exception.

title: super!!!
review: It's so beautiful and unique. we visited in the afternoon and it looks so georgeous by Taj Mahal building.

title: spiritual in a grand way
review: this masjid is inside the taj so a must visit for Taj visitors..

title: Jawab Masjid
review: This is inside the Taj Mahal in Agra. It is made of red sandstone and has been made for aesthetic appeal to keep the Taj Mahal symmetrical.  This mosque is still used on Fridays and provides a place of prayer and worship.

title: Mosque
review: This mosque is on left hand side of taj mahal when seen from the enterance and an identical building is on the right side of taj which is mehman khana(gathering hall)

title: Lovely views of the Taj
review: This is a peaceful spot. You can capture a great image of the Taj Mahal through the center doorway.  Nice to enjoy the view as others come to worship.

title: Honeymoon
review: Honeymoon trip ! Safe and clean ! Family oriented ! Best restaurant ! Great food ! Easy access to public transport ! Highly spirited ! Nice awesome ! Love to go back again !

title: The Mosk inside of Taj Mahal,
review: The Mosk inside of miraculous Taj Mahal. On of the two mosks on the sides, actually. U are supposed to take off your shoes before entering.

title: A mosque inside Tajmahal
review: There are 2 similar kind of building on both sides on Taj mahal. One is this mosque, and the other is a guest house for the royal guests. This place is at the same complex of Taj main building. Beautifully decorated and a very nice peice of art.

title: Visit this mosque
review: The mosque is a wonderful place to photograph the Taj through arches and doorways. Be sure to remove your shoes.

title: wonderful
review: Very interesting complex with a lot of history. It gives a very peaceful atmosphere but not as magnificent as the Taj Mahal.

title: Mini Mahal
review: Stunning design. The time that it would have taken to create this iconic mini Mahal with the Taj Mahal site is enormous. Grab a tour guide or audio guide and meander amongst the beauty of this site.

title: Nice Masjid
review: This masjid is awesome as there is another monument on other side with same look for symmetrical architecture.

title: Nothing Special !!
review: This is a normal masjid/mosque, the only thing special about it is that it is part of the Taj Mahal complex, even the guide will tell you there is nothing special inside, and it was built in a way to preserve the symmetry between the right and left sides of the main building.

title: Mosque beside the Taj
review: While visiting the Taj Mahal take some time to appreciate the mosque built beside it. The red brick compliments the excessive use of white marble everywhere else. The sun sets behind this mosque and makes for great photos if you are at the Taj late in the day.

title: Smaller than you'd think
review: Quite an eerie hush when you enter the inside of the Taj.  A one way system is operated, which is a necessity.  You are not allowed to take photographs and on this the guards are very strict although I did see one young girl take a photo on her phone and she had a fight to keep the guards from confiscating the phone. Might have been easier for them to ask her to delete the photograph maybe. Anyway, inside is not as elaborate as I thought it would be, there are the two tombs there and again it is important to know the history behind the tombs to get the real benefit of the attraction.

title: A great building next to the Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical buildings , one on each side of the Taj Mahal. One is a Mosque and one is a guest house. I believe this is the Mosque.

title: Filthy and peddlers galore
review: Maybe it was because we saw the Taj Mahal the day before but we were hugely disappointed with this 'recommended' attraction. The place is filthy - full of bird droppings. For the equivalent cost of a new sarong, we were charged to rent them at the gate to 'cover up'. Back outside, we were hassled by another peddler to pay for 'looking after' our slippers. Not worth it, Stay away!

title: Stunning, but almost ignored
review: If Jawab Masjid was on its own, and not 100 metres from the Taj Mahal, you'd want to go and visit it.  But it's totally overshadowed by the Taj Mahal and many people don't even bother to walk the very short distance to look at it.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: This is an additional treat that can be seen once inside the security area. It is lovely and I am glad I visited it, but be aware there are steps.

title: Mosque next to Taj Mahal
review: This beautiful mosque rather loses out in comparison to its illustrious neighbour, but it certainly has its own beauty and appeal, especially the contrasting colours.

title: Next to Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical and symmetrical red sandstone buildings either  side of the glistening white Taj Mahal. This one is a Mosque and I believe that the other offers some type of accommodation.  Photography is banned inside.

title: Beautiful monument
review: This beautiful red sandstone building stands as a sharp contrast to Taj Mahal's white marble monument. in its entirety; it looks very beautiful. #suhaskatti

title: stunning
review: Stunning building. is such a massive building as well. Well worth a visit and you can get some brilliant pictures.

title: Beautiful
review: This part of the Taj Mahal was designed by three architects from three different religions. They combined their ideas to build a red sandstone building with carvings that  beg you to photograph them. The late afternoon sun gave the stone a glow that added to its beauty.

title: Smaller than you'd think
review: Quite an eerie hush when you enter the inside of the Taj.  A one way system is operated, which is a necessity.  You are not allowed to take photographs and on this the guards are very strict although I did see one young girl take a photo on her phone and she had a fight to keep the guards from confiscating the phone. Might have been easier for them to ask her to delete the photograph maybe. Anyway, inside is not as elaborate as I thought it would be, there are the two tombs there and again it is important to know the history behind the tombs to get the real benefit of the attraction.

title: stunning
review: Stunning building. is such a massive building as well. Well worth a visit and you can get some brilliant pictures.

title: Beautiful sculpture
review: This red building inside Taj Mahal  - Agra is a must watch with its actual beauty. Would have been even more better if there was a notice board depicting the importance of the tomb and the reason behind the building

You are not allowed to take photographs and on this the guards are very strict although I did see one young girl take a photo on her phone and she had a fight to keep the guards from confiscating the phone. Might have been easier for them to ask her to delete the photograph maybe. Anyway, inside is not as elaborate as I thought it would be, there are the two tombs there and again it is important to know the history behind the tombs to get the real benefit of the attraction.

title: A great building next to the Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical buildings , one on each side of the Taj Mahal. One is a Mosque and one is a guest house. I believe this is the Mosque.

title: stunning
review: Stunning building. is such a massive building as well. Well worth a visit and you can get some brilliant pictures.

title: Next to Taj Mahal
review: There are two identical and symmetrical red sandstone buildings either  side of the glistening white Taj Mahal. This one is a Mosque and I believe that the other offers some type of accommodation.  Photography is banned inside.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: This is an additional treat that can be seen once inside the security area. It is lovely and I am glad I visited it, but be aware there are steps.

title: Mosque next to Taj Mahal
review: This beautiful mosque rather loses out in comparison to its illustrious neighbour, but it certainly has its own beauty and appeal, especially the contrasting colours.

title: Beautiful sculpture
review: This red building inside Taj Mahal  - Agra is a must watch with its actual beauty. Would have been even more better if there was a notice board depicting the importance of the tomb and the reason behind the building

title: Stunning, but almost ignored
review: If Jawab Masjid was on its own, and not 100 metres from the Taj Mahal, you'd want to go and visit it.  But it's totally overshadowed by the Taj Mahal and many people don't even bother to walk the very short distance to look at it.

title: Beautiful monument
review: This beautiful red sandstone building stands as a sharp contrast to Taj Mahal's white marble monument. in its entirety; it looks very beautiful. #suhaskatti

title: Beautiful
review: This part of the Taj Mahal was designed by three architects from three different religions. They combined their ideas to build a red sandstone building with carvings that  beg you to photograph them. The late afternoon sun gave the stone a glow that added to its beauty.
